citations.narrative:
On August 24, 2023, the license was transporting a dog. After stopping for a rest break for the dog to relieve himself, the
animal was released from its seat belt then bolted out of the vehicle. According to the registrant, the dog was running
loose in the rest area and surrounding woods. Efforts were made to capture the dog by the registrant as well as the
public. The dog was eventually captured and safely returned to the vehicle. The dog was probably stressed due to the
escape and efforts to capture it. The dog's ability to escape indicated that handling was not completed quickly and
carefully as possible.
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma,
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
The registrant transported a dog in a vehicle and it was only secured by a dog seat belt, which attaches to the dog's collar
and vehicle seatbelt hook. The registrant did not utilize a primary enclosure in order to contain the dog that was being
transported.
The dog or cat must be contained in a primary enclosure such as a compartment, transport cage, carton, or crate.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the registrant.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
On August 24, 2023, the license was transporting a dog. After stopping for a rest break for the dog to relieve himself, the 
animal was released from its seat belt then bolted out of the vehicle. According to the registrant, the dog was running 
loose in the rest area and surrounding woods. Efforts were made to capture the dog by the registrant as well as the 
public. The dog was eventually captured and safely returned to the vehicle. The dog was probably stressed due to the 
escape and efforts to capture it. The dog's ability to escape indicated that handling was not completed quickly and 
carefully as possible. 
 
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, 
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort. 
3.15(a) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats. 
The registrant transported a dog in a vehicle and it was only secured by a dog seat belt, which attaches to the dog's collar 
and vehicle seatbelt hook. The registrant did not utilize a primary enclosure in order to contain the dog that was being 
transported. 
 
The dog or cat must be contained in a primary enclosure such as a compartment, transport cage, carton, or crate. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the registrant. 
 
 n
